issue.title: Delta в игре понимается тремя взаимно противоречивыми способами.
issue.body:
Сюрмап понимает дельту как толщину верхнего слоя, и, судя по всему, так и предполагалось изначально:

https://github.com/KranX/Vangers/blob/5a214b175fc29dfa750b1c1e71cbbd81aa1d00bb/src/terra/render.h#L109-L118

При рендеринге в 3d провода выглядят нормально:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/964238/199963280-469790d6-dfda-4ac0-b9d2-9d0164ff55b1.png)

Физика расчета пуль понимает дельту как высоту пещеры:

https://github.com/KranX/Vangers/blob/5a214b175fc29dfa750b1c1e71cbbd81aa1d00bb/src/units/hobj.cpp#L1555-L1564

При рендеринге в 3d провода вытянуты вниз:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/964238/199963317-35c9c735-11e0-4469-b17f-cfd769277463.png)

Физика расчета 3d объектов вообще игнорирует дельту и использует фиксированную ширину верхнего слоя:

https://github.com/KranX/Vangers/blob/5a214b175fc29dfa750b1c1e71cbbd81aa1d00bb/src/3d/dynamics.cpp#L67
Визуализации в 3d третьего способа нет.

pull_request.title: Fix middle height computation in 3D dynamics
pull_request.body: The semantics (and usage) of the function is such that it returns 4 bytes: lower height, middle height, upper height, and 0xFF. I believe the brackets "(" and ")" were accidentally put in the wrong place here for the middle term.

repo.name: Vangers
repo.description: Video game that combines elements of the racing and role-playing genres.

repo.name: Vangers
repo.description: The video game that combines elements of the racing and role-playing genres.

commits.message:
Fix middle height computation in 3D dynamics

The semantics (and usage) of the function is such that it returns 4 bytes: lower height, middle height, upper height, and 0xFF.
I believe the brackets "(" and ")" were accidentally put in the wrong place here for the middle term.

issue.title: [meta] Voxel ray tracing plan
issue.body:
- [x] land the implementation - #218
- [ ] create tools to measure GPU time, to start optimization
- [ ] use Morton codes for the terrain buffer. This will improve data locality access patterns. Possibly, use a 2x2 texel tile as the basis (instead of the 2x1 that we have today). Probably need to update it in a compute shader.
  - [ ] alternatively, switch the terrain buffer to an R32Uint texture (storing 2 texels)
- [x] store voxel data into a buffer as well. Use Morton codes for addressing. Pack bits into 32bit words.
- [x] optimize voxel construction. It takes too long to load a level.
- [ ] address the portability issues, e.g. #222
- [ ] environment map for the sky
- [ ] describe the rendering approach in the blog.

comment.body: WIth #223 I'm seeing the time for RT raising to 48ms (about 20% hike). Still worth it given the reduced VRAM, and now we are mostly ALU bound, which scales better with GPUs.

commits.message:
Switch voxel data to a buffer with Morton codes

Reduces the amount of VRAM by 32x for the voxel struct.
Also support dirty rect updates properly.
Switch terrain height to 256, adjust voxel defaults

pull_request.title: Switch voxel data to a buffer with Morton codes
pull_request.body:
Part of #221

We are also switching `HEIGHT_SCALE` to 256 here.

Baseline on my Mac - the default camera of the Level binary on Fostral, default window size.
40ms for RT. Texture units are busy 98.7% of the time.

issue.title: Metal just returns NULL when creating a large 3D texture

labels.name: external: driver-bug
labels.description: A driver is causing the bug, though we may still want to work around it

issue.body:
**Description**
I'm creating an R32Uint texture of size 1024x2048x256, and this line just returns a NULL handle:
```rust
let raw = self.shared.device.lock().new_texture(&descriptor);
```
A smaller size works (e.g. 192 for the depth).
It's either a driver bug, or we are hitting another limit that we don't know about.

**Repro steps**
available upon demand :)
This happens in vange-rs

**Expected vs observed behavior**
We should return an error, or succeed.

**Extra materials**

**Platform**
> MacBook Pro (13-inch, 2016, Four Thunderbolt 3 Ports)
> Intel Iris Graphics 550 1536 MB
> MacOS 12.6.1 (21G217)

Basic infrastructure for voxel ray tracing

Includes creation of a grid texture, compute passes
for populating it with mipmap levels, and a rough ray-tracing
algorithm with a reasonable fallback.
Debug voxelization, use atomics for workgroups

Unzooming tech

Step through basic LOD voxels
Add UI to the level viewer, improve camera controls
Repeat the world in the ray-voxel path

issue.title: Load shaders first, then the level
issue.body: Level data can be allocated quickly, but takes time to read. There is no reason why we can't be loading shaders while the level is being filled up.

+ron = "0.5.1"
comment.body: Can we use 0.7.1 now?

issue.title: Load shaders first, then the level
issue.body: Level data can be allocated quickly, but takes time to read. There is no reason why we can't be loading shaders while the level is being filled up.

issue.title: Error span reported on the declaration of a variable instead of its use
wgpu RenderPass with a depth/stencil attachment
issue.body:
Related to #2022

**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**
My main render pass has a depth/stencil attachment. I'm using `egui_wgpu_backend`, and [render pass creation](https://docs.rs/egui_wgpu_backend/0.19.0/egui_wgpu_backend/struct.RenderPass.html#method.new) assumes no depth/stencil involved.
That means, I can't render egui in my main render pass (it's incompatible with a render pipeline you create). That's unfortunate and wasteful on tiling GPU architectures.

**Describe the solution you'd like**
Have an `Option<wgpu::TextureFormat>` argument for the render pass creation, where the user would tell the format for depth/stencil, if any. It should involve minimal changes on egui wgpu side, could be done as another render pass constructor, e.g. `RenderPass::with_depth_stencil`.

**Describe alternatives you've considered**
None.

**Additional context**
Downstream work - https://github.com/kvark/vange-rs/pull/214
Egui looks great overall, thank you for amazing work!

comment.body: You mean https://github.com/emilk/egui/blob/c414af7aa2858703d2ff5d72b8dbf1a657da5991/crates/egui-wgpu/src/renderer.rs#L156 specifically. Glad to see this fixed!

pull_request.title: ReSTIR example
pull_request.body: (A draft until the spatial reuse is fixed). See https://cs.dartmouth.edu/wjarosz/publications/bitterli20spatiotemporal.html for background. This example demonstrates practical use of reservoirs by evaluating directed light in a 2D world with a simple occluder. Target PDF is the incoming light intensity multiplied by visibility.

wgpu RenderPass with a depth/stencil attachment
issue.body:
Related to #2022

**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**
My main render pass has a depth/stencil attachment. I'm using `egui_wgpu_backend`, and [render pass creation](https://docs.rs/egui_wgpu_backend/0.19.0/egui_wgpu_backend/struct.RenderPass.html#method.new) assumes no depth/stencil involved.
That means, I can't render egui in my main render pass (it's incompatible with a render pipeline you create). That's unfortunate and wasteful on tiling GPU architectures.

**Describe the solution you'd like**
Have an `Option<wgpu::TextureFormat>` argument for the render pass creation, where the user would tell the format for depth/stencil, if any. It should involve minimal changes on egui wgpu side, could be done as another render pass constructor, e.g. `RenderPass::with_depth_stencil`.

**Describe alternatives you've considered**
None.

**Additional context**
Downstream work - https://github.com/kvark/vange-rs/pull/214
Egui looks great overall, thank you for amazing work!

comment.body: You mean https://github.com/emilk/egui/blob/c414af7aa2858703d2ff5d72b8dbf1a657da5991/crates/egui-wgpu/src/renderer.rs#L156 specifically. Glad to see this fixed!

issue.body:
Сюрмап понимает дельту как толщину верхнего слоя, и, судя по всему, так и предполагалось изначально:

https://github.com/KranX/Vangers/blob/5a214b175fc29dfa750b1c1e71cbbd81aa1d00bb/src/terra/render.h#L109-L118

При рендеринге в 3d провода выглядят нормально:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/964238/199963280-469790d6-dfda-4ac0-b9d2-9d0164ff55b1.png)

Физика расчета пуль понимает дельту как высоту пещеры:

https://github.com/KranX/Vangers/blob/5a214b175fc29dfa750b1c1e71cbbd81aa1d00bb/src/units/hobj.cpp#L1555-L1564

При рендеринге в 3d провода вытянуты вниз:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/964238/199963317-35c9c735-11e0-4469-b17f-cfd769277463.png)

Физика расчета 3d объектов вообще игнорирует дельту и использует фиксированную ширину верхнего слоя:

https://github.com/KranX/Vangers/blob/5a214b175fc29dfa750b1c1e71cbbd81aa1d00bb/src/3d/dynamics.cpp#L67
Визуализации в 3d третьего способа нет.

pull_request.title: Fix middle height computation in 3D dynamics
pull_request.body: The semantics (and usage) of the function is such that it returns 4 bytes: lower height, middle height, upper height, and 0xFF. I believe the brackets "(" and ")" were accidentally put in the wrong place here for the middle term.

repo.name: Vangers
repo.description: Video game that combines elements of the racing and role-playing genres.

repo.name: Vangers
repo.description: The video game that combines elements of the racing and role-playing genres.

commits.message:
Fix middle height computation in 3D dynamics

The semantics (and usage) of the function is such that it returns 4 bytes: lower height, middle height, upper height, and 0xFF.
I believe the brackets "(" and ")" were accidentally put in the wrong place here for the middle term.

issue.title: [meta] Voxel ray tracing plan
issue.body:
- [x] land the implementation - #218
- [ ] create tools to measure GPU time, to start optimization
- [ ] use Morton codes for the terrain buffer. This will improve data locality access patterns. Possibly, use a 2x2 texel tile as the basis (instead of the 2x1 that we have today). Probably need to update it in a compute shader.
  - [ ] alternatively, switch the terrain buffer to an R32Uint texture (storing 2 texels)
- [x] store voxel data into a buffer as well. Use Morton codes for addressing. Pack bits into 32bit words.
- [x] optimize voxel construction. It takes too long to load a level.
- [ ] address the portability issues, e.g. #222
- [ ] environment map for the sky
- [ ] describe the rendering approach in the blog.

comment.body: WIth #223 I'm seeing the time for RT raising to 48ms (about 20% hike). Still worth it given the reduced VRAM, and now we are mostly ALU bound, which scales better with GPUs.

commits.message:
Switch voxel data to a buffer with Morton codes

Reduces the amount of VRAM by 32x for the voxel struct.
Also support dirty rect updates properly.
Switch terrain height to 256, adjust voxel defaults

40ms for RT. Texture units are busy 98.7% of the time.

issue.title: Metal just returns NULL when creating a large 3D texture

labels.name: external: driver-bug
labels.description: A driver is causing the bug, though we may still want to work around it

issue.body:
**Description**
I'm creating an R32Uint texture of size 1024x2048x256, and this line just returns a NULL handle:
```rust
let raw = self.shared.device.lock().new_texture(&descriptor);
```
A smaller size works (e.g. 192 for the depth).
It's either a driver bug, or we are hitting another limit that we don't know about.

**Repro steps**
available upon demand :)
This happens in vange-rs

**Expected vs observed behavior**
We should return an error, or succeed.

**Extra materials**

**Platform**
> MacBook Pro (13-inch, 2016, Four Thunderbolt 3 Ports)
> Intel Iris Graphics 550 1536 MB
> MacOS 12.6.1 (21G217)

algorithm with a reasonable fallback.

Step through basic LOD voxels
Add UI to the level viewer, improve camera controls
Repeat the world in the ray-voxel path

issue.title: Load shaders first, then the level
issue.body: Level data can be allocated quickly, but takes time to read. There is no reason why we can't be loading shaders while the level is being filled up.

issue.title: Load shaders first, then the level
issue.body: Level data can be allocated quickly, but takes time to read. There is no reason why we can't be loading shaders while the level is being filled up.

issue.title: Error span reported on the declaration of a variable instead of its use
wgpu RenderPass with a depth/stencil attachment
issue.body:
Related to #2022

**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**
My main render pass has a depth/stencil attachment. I'm using `egui_wgpu_backend`, and [render pass creation](https://docs.rs/egui_wgpu_backend/0.19.0/egui_wgpu_backend/struct.RenderPass.html#method.new) assumes no depth/stencil involved.
That means, I can't render egui in my main render pass (it's incompatible with a render pipeline you create). That's unfortunate and wasteful on tiling GPU architectures.

**Describe the solution you'd like**
Have an `Option<wgpu::TextureFormat>` argument for the render pass creation, where the user would tell the format for depth/stencil, if any. It should involve minimal changes on egui wgpu side, could be done as another render pass constructor, e.g. `RenderPass::with_depth_stencil`.

**Describe alternatives you've considered**
None.

**Additional context**
Downstream work - https://github.com/kvark/vange-rs/pull/214
Egui looks great overall, thank you for amazing work!

comment.body: You mean https://github.com/emilk/egui/blob/c414af7aa2858703d2ff5d72b8dbf1a657da5991/crates/egui-wgpu/src/renderer.rs#L156 specifically. Glad to see this fixed!

pull_request.title: ReSTIR example
pull_request.body: (A draft until the spatial reuse is fixed). See https://cs.dartmouth.edu/wjarosz/publications/bitterli20spatiotemporal.html for background. This example demonstrates practical use of reservoirs by evaluating directed light in a 2D world with a simple occluder. Target PDF is the incoming light intensity multiplied by visibility.
